meanings.definition: Used for emphasis or to express annoyance or anger.
meanings.sent1: Confounded! I can't believe I forgot my keys again!
meanings.sent2: Oh, confounded mosquitoes buzzing around me!
meanings.sent3: Confounded! I spilled my drink all over my new shirt.
meanings.sent4: The confounded rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: Confounded! Why is the Wi-Fi not working when I need it the most?

meanings.sent1: She looked confounded when she saw the unexpected guest at the party.
meanings.sent2: The confounded maze had us wandering in circles for hours.
meanings.sent3: His confounded expression made me realize he misunderstood my joke.
meanings.sent4: The confounded math problem seemed unsolvable at first.
meanings.sent5: The confounded look on his face told me he was lost in thought.

meanings.sent1: The confounded pirate ship was said to bring bad luck to all who boarded it.
meanings.sent2: Legend has it that the confounded treasure was protected by a curse.
meanings.sent3: The confounded ghost was said to haunt the old mansion at night.
meanings.sent4: The confounded artifact was believed to hold a dark power within.
meanings.sent5: The confounded curse was finally lifted after generations of misfortune.
